intro: Luma gilliesii, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family and is characterized by its tall, grass-like foliage. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or brown in color. Luma gilliesii is often found in wetland habitats and is adapted to thrive in moist, temperate climates. It plays an important ecological role in its native environment.
